text:
Hi,

Quoting : 
http://developer.apple.com/fonts/TTRefMan/RM06/Chap6cmap.html#Surrogates
			 
The original architecture of the Unicode Standard allowed for all encoded 
characters to be represented using sixteen bit code points. This allowed for up 
to 65,354 characters to be encoded. (Unicode code points U+FFFE and U+FFFF are 
reserved and unavailable to represent characters. For more details, see The 
Unicode Standard.)
			 
My comment : Isn't there a typo here ? Shouldn't we rather read 65,534 here ?

Anyway, CmapFormat4 (an maybe other thable formats) should de a
